meanings.sent1: The complex instructions may bewilder the new students.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected turn of events can bewilder even the most experienced hiker.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solve a riddle without any clues can truly bewilder a person.
meanings.sent4: The intricate maze of thoughts in his mind seemed to bewilder him more each day.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks never failed to bewilder the audience with their mystery.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become lost or disoriented
meanings.sent1: The dense fog can bewilder travelers on the unfamiliar path.
meanings.sent2: The winding streets of the old town can easily bewilder visitors.
meanings.sent3: The sudden change in weather seemed to bewilder the birds in flight.
meanings.sent4: The vastness of the desert landscape can bewilder those unprepared for its emptiness.
meanings.sent5: The intricate dance routine seemed to bewilder the clumsy dancer with its complexity.
